meanings.definition: A piece of iron or other material which has its component atoms so ordered that the material exhibits properties of magnetism, such as attracting other iron-containing objects or aligning itself in an external magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnets on the fridge held up my drawing.
meanings.sent2: She used magnets to pick up the metal screws.
meanings.sent3: The magnets in the store window pulled me in to look at the display.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like magnets, drawing everyone to her.
meanings.sent5: The magnets in the compass pointed north, guiding us home.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has a powerful attraction or charm.
meanings.sent1: The movie star was a magnet for fans wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant became a magnet for food lovers in the city.
meanings.sent3: The shiny new car was like a magnet, attracting attention from everyone.
meanings.sent4: His charisma acted like magnets, pulling people towards him.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers in the garden were a magnet for butterflies.
